page.title: 16CHICHESTER-LOCAL INTEREST 2.
page.content: The {Cawley Almshouses }were built in 1625 near Northgate and were later the city workhouse. Near Spitalfield Lane is{ England's oldest council house.}It is the remains of a leper hospital. The house was rebuilt after a fire in the 1760's and it includes scrap stone from the older buildings. At Portfield in the old All Saint's Church is the {Mechanical Music & Doll Collection.}It houses a working collection dating from the 1830's to 1930's. {Bishop {Otter College, }now part of the {West {Sussex Institute of Higher Education, is adjacent to {Oaklands Park.}This Church of England College has offered teacher training since 1839. Today it offers a wide choice of courses. In the park, distinguished by its Mediterranean oak trees, is Oaklands House, now a part of the college and a teachers' professional centre.
